Detailed Description

Some Bluetooth Profiles permit only one remote device connection to itself. BtSingleConnectionController is the controller base class for such kind of profiles. BtSingleConnectionController implements

Member Function Documentation

BtServiceRequest * BtSingleConnectionController::CleanUpRequestExecution (  BtResultCode  result_code,
BtRequestType  request_type
)  [protected]
 

Finalize the execution of an currently executing request.

When a request is submitted to the Bluetooth stack for execution, the Bluetooth stack function can return FALSE, if the request is rejected by the Bluetooth stack, or the appropriate callback function is called to report the state of the ongoing request. In all of these cases CleanUpRequestExecution should be called.
CleanUpRequestExecution determines on the passed in parameters whether the member variable m_executing_request should be cleared or not. When CleanUpRequestExecution resets m_executing_request to 0, the id of the cleared request is returned.

Parameters:
result_code A BtResultCode containing the result of the execution of the currently ongoing request.
request_type A BtRequestType containing the kind of request for which the result code is passed in.
Returns:
((UINT32)(-1)) Depending on result_code and request_type the function decided not to resest m_executing_request to 0.
Any other UINT32 m_executing_request is set to 0 and the id of the finalized request is returned.

void BtSingleConnectionController::ClearConnectedDevice (   )  [protected]
 

Clear the connected device.

If a device is connected to the profile this controller is representing, the connected device is stored in the member variable m_connected_device. This function is used to clear to the m_connected_device member variable.

BOOLEAN BtSingleConnectionController::ConnectRequest (  BtConnectRequest *  connect_request  )  [protected]
 

Set up a Service between two devices.

OpenServiceRequest instructs the Bluetooth stack to perform a Service set up based on the settings passed in.

Parameters:
connect_settings.A reference to a btapi_connect_t containing the settings for the Service to be set up.
Returns:
TRUE The passed in paramaters are correct and the request is submitted to the Bluetooth stack.
FALSE The passed in paramters are incorrect and the request is not submitted to the Bluetooth stack.

BOOLEAN BtSingleConnectionController::DisconnectRequest (  BtDisconnectRequest *  disconnect_request  )  [protected]
 

Close a Service between two devices.

CloseServiceRequest instructs the Blluetooth stack to perform a close Service based on the settings passed in.

Parameters:
disconnect_settings.A reference to a btapi_disconnect_t containing the settings for Service to be closed.
Returns:
TRUE The passed in paramaters are correct and the request is submitted to the Bluetooth stack.
FALSE The passed in paramters are incorrect and the request is not submitted to the Bluetooth stack.

const BtDevice & BtSingleConnectionController::GetConnectedDevice (   )  const [protected]
 

BtServiceRequest * BtSingleConnectionController::GetExecutingRequest (   )  const [protected]
 

Return currently executing request.

The execution of requests within the controller is limited to one request at a time. A pointer to the currently running request is stored in the member variable m_executing_request. This member variable is used to save informations about the request during its execution in the Bluetooth stack and to enable the assignment between the callback function calls and the request.

Returns:
A pointer to a BtRequest containing the currently running request or 0, if no reqeust is currently running.

BOOLEAN BtSingleConnectionController::IsDeviceConnected (  const BtDevice &  device  )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Is the passed in device connected to this profile or not?

IsDeviceConnected is used by the BtService class to determine whether it's target is connected to it's profile or not.

Parameters:
device A reference to a BtDevice containing the remoted device that should be tested whether it is connected to this profile or not.
Returns:
TRUE The passed in device is correct to this profile.
FALSE The passed in device is not correct to this profile.

Implements BtConnectionBasedController.

BOOLEAN BtSingleConnectionController::PrepareRequestExecution (  BtServiceRequest *  request  )  [protected]
 

Perpare the execution of a submitted request.

When a request is submitted to the controller for execution PrepareRequestExecution checks if an other request is currently running. If so the function returns FALSE, otherwise the member variable m_executing_request is set to point to the passed in request and TRUE is returned.

Parameters:
request A pointer to a BtRequest, that should be exectuted.
Returns:
TRUE The passed in request can be executed.
FALSE There is an other request currently running, so the passed in request can not be executed.

BOOLEAN BtSingleConnectionController::SetConnectedDevice (  const BtDevice &  connected_device  )  [protected]
 

Set the connected device.

If a device is connected to the profile this controller is representing, the connected device is stored in the member variable m_connected_device. This function is used to set to the m_connected_device member variable.

Parameters:
connected_device A reference to a BtDevice containing the device to which the member variable m_connected_device has to be set to,
Returns:
TRUE The member variable m_connected_devicey is set correctly.
FALSE There is another device connected to this controller (profile) and must be disconnected prior setting the new connected device.
